title: Appointed Times & Holy Days Commandments Quiz - Biblical Commands About Appointed Times & Holy Days
description: Test your knowledge of the 41 biblical commandments related to appointed times & holy days. Covers 23 positive and 18 negative commandments from the Torah.

questions.question: Which commandment requires resting on the seventh day Sabbath?
options: Rest on the seventh day Sabbath
Do not eat or drink on the Day of Atonement
Take up a Lulav and Etrog all seven days
Afflict yourself on the Day of Atonement
questions.correctAnswer: Rest on the seventh day Sabbath
questions.explanation: Commandment #87 mandates resting on the seventh day Sabbath to allow rest for both people and animals, as stated in Exodus 23:12.

questions.question: What is a negative commandment concerning the Sabbath day?
options: Do not do prohibited labor on the seventh day Sabbath
Sanctify the Sabbath in speech
Rest on the first day of Passover
Eat unleavened bread on the first night of Passover
questions.correctAnswer: Do not do prohibited labor on the seventh day Sabbath
questions.explanation: Commandment #88 prohibits performing any prohibited labor on the Sabbath day as found in Exodus 20:10.

questions.question: On which feast must you "afflict yourself" as a positive commandment?
options: The Day of Atonement
Passover
The Feast of Weeks
The Feast of Tabernacles
questions.correctAnswer: The Day of Atonement
questions.explanation: Commandment #94 instructs to afflict yourself on the Day of Atonement, a positive commandment found in Leviticus 16:29.

questions.question: Which commandment forbids kindling a fire on the Sabbath?
options: The court must not inflict punishment on the Sabbath
Do not kindle a fire on the Day of Atonement
Do not do prohibited labor on the Feast of Trumpets
Do not eat leaven all seven days of Passover
questions.correctAnswer: The court must not inflict punishment on the Sabbath
questions.explanation: Commandment #89 prohibits kindling fire or inflicting punishment on the Sabbath, as stated in Exodus 35:3.

questions.question: True or False: Eating leavened bread is permitted during the seven days of Passover.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Commandments #110 and #111 forbid eating leavened bread or mixtures during the entire seven days of Passover (Exodus 13:3 and Exodus 12:20).

questions.question: Which commandment is positive and involves hearing the ram's horn?
options: Hear the ram's horn on the Feast of Trumpets
Rest on the Feast of Trumpets
Do not do prohibited labor on the Feast of Trumpets
Rejoice on Passover, the Feast of Weeks, and the Feast of Tabernacles
questions.correctAnswer: Hear the ram's horn on the Feast of Trumpets
questions.explanation: Commandment #116 requires hearing the ram's horn on the Feast of Trumpets as a positive commandment found in Numbers 29:1.

questions.question: What is the positive commandment related to the annual half shekel?
options: Each male Israelite must give a half shekel annually
Rejoice on the Feast of Weeks
Dwell in a temporary shelter for the seven days of the Feast of Tabernacles
Afflict yourself on the Day of Atonement
questions.correctAnswer: Each male Israelite must give a half shekel annually
questions.explanation: Commandment #119 requires every male Israelite to give a half shekel annually, as stated in Exodus 30:13.

questions.question: True or False: You must not appear at the Temple during Passover without bringing offerings.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Commandment #423 forbids appearing at the Temple during Passover, Feast of Weeks, and Feast of Tabernacles without offerings (Deuteronomy 16:16).

questions.question: On which day of Passover is a holy convocation commanded with no laborious work?
options: First day
Third day
Fifth day
Seventh day
questions.correctAnswer: First day
questions.explanation: Commandment #96 requires resting on the first day of Passover with a holy convocation and prohibition of laborious work, according to Leviticus 23:7.

questions.question: Which commandment requires dwelling in booths during the Feast of Tabernacles?
options: Dwell in a temporary shelter for the seven days of the Feast of Tabernacles
Rest on the seventh day of Passover
Take up a Lulav and Etrog all seven days of the Feast of Tabernacles
Eat unleavened bread on the first night of Passover
questions.correctAnswer: Dwell in a temporary shelter for the seven days of the Feast of Tabernacles
questions.explanation: Commandment #117 mandates dwelling in booths for seven days during the Feast of Tabernacles as found in Leviticus 23:42.

questions.question: True or False: The month of Passover (Nisan) is commanded to be the first month of the year.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Commandment #120 states that the month of Passover (Nisan) shall be the first month of the year according to Exodus 12:2.

questions.question: Which commandment forbids eating or drinking on the Day of Atonement?
options: Do not eat or drink on the Day of Atonement
Rest on the Feast of Weeks
Take up a Lulav and Etrog all seven days
Afflict yourself on the Day of Atonement
questions.correctAnswer: Do not eat or drink on the Day of Atonement
questions.explanation: Commandment #95 forbids eating or drinking on the Day of Atonement as stated in Leviticus 23:29.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: You shall not do any laborious work on the _____ day of the Feast of Tabernacles.
options: first
third
fifth
seventh
questions.correctAnswer: first
questions.explanation: Commandment #105 prohibits doing laborious work on the first day of the Feast of Tabernacles, as per Leviticus 23:35.

questions.question: Which commandment instructs to rest from prohibited labor on the Day of Atonement?
options: Rest from prohibited labor on the Day of Atonement
Do not do prohibited labor on the seventh day Sabbath
Rest on the Feast of Weeks
Do not eat leavened food on the afternoon of the 14th day of Nisan
questions.correctAnswer: Rest from prohibited labor on the Day of Atonement
questions.explanation: Commandment #93 requires resting from prohibited labor on the Day of Atonement, as found in Leviticus 23:32.

questions.question: True or False: You may walk outside the city boundary on the Sabbath according to the commandments.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Commandment #90 forbids walking outside the city boundary on the Sabbath, as stated in Exodus 16:29.

questions.question: Which commandment requires telling your son the reason for Passover on the first night?
options: Relate the Exodus from Egypt on the first night Passover
Eat unleavened bread on the first night of Passover
Destroy all leaven on 14th day of Nisan
Rejoice on Passover, the Feast of Weeks, and the Feast of Tabernacles
questions.correctAnswer: Relate the Exodus from Egypt on the first night Passover
questions.explanation: Commandment #115 instructs to tell your son on the first night of Passover about the Exodus from Egypt, found in Exodus 13:8.

questions.question: Which of the following is a negative commandment related to Passover?
options: Do not eat leavened bread all seven days of Passover
Rest on the Feast of Trumpets
Each male Israelite must give a half shekel annually
Hear the ram's horn on the Feast of Trumpets
questions.correctAnswer: Do not eat leavened bread all seven days of Passover
questions.explanation: Commandment #110 forbids eating leavened bread during all seven days of Passover (Exodus 13:3).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: On the Feast of Tabernacles, you shall take up a ____ and Etrog all seven days.
options: Lulav
Shofar
Shekel
Sabbath
questions.correctAnswer: Lulav
questions.explanation: Commandment #118 requires taking up a Lulav and Etrog during the seven days of the Feast of Tabernacles, as per Leviticus 23:40.

questions.question: Which positive commandment involves counting seven weeks from the day the new wheat offering was brought after Passover?
options: Each man must count seven weeks from the day the new wheat offering was brought after Passover
Rest on the Feast of Weeks
Afflict yourself on the Day of Atonement
Dwell in a temporary shelter for seven days
questions.correctAnswer: Each man must count seven weeks from the day the new wheat offering was brought after Passover
questions.explanation: Commandment #385 instructs counting seven weeks from the day after the sabbath when the new wheat offering was brought, as found in Leviticus 23:15.

questions.question: True or False: You are commanded to rejoice and bring a peace offering on Passover, the Feast of Weeks, and the Feast of Tabernacles.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Commandments #421 and #422 command rejoicing and bringing a peace offering on Passover, Feast of Weeks, and Feast of Tabernacles (Exodus 23:14; Deuteronomy 16:14).

questions.question: What must you do on the eighth day of the Feast of Tabernacles according to a positive commandment?
options: Rest and have a holy convocation
Perform laborious work
Eat leavened bread
Afflict yourself
questions.correctAnswer: Rest and have a holy convocation
questions.explanation: Commandment #106 requires resting and holding a holy convocation on the eighth day of the Feast of Tabernacles (Leviticus 23:36).

questions.question: Which commandment forbids seeing leaven in your domain during Passover?
options: Do not see leaven in your domain seven days during Passover
Do not eat leavened bread on the seventh day of Passover
Do not do prohibited labor on the Feast of Trumpets
Rest on the first day of Passover
questions.correctAnswer: Do not see leaven in your domain seven days during Passover
questions.explanation: Commandment #112 forbids seeing leaven anywhere in your domain during the seven days of Passover (Exodus 13:7).

questions.question: True or False: You must assemble all the people on the Feast of Tabernacles following the seventh year.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Commandment #425 requires assembling all the people for the Feast of Tabernacles after every seventh year (Deuteronomy 31:10).

questions.question: Which commandment prohibits refraining from rejoicing with and giving gifts to the Levites on the Pilgrimage Festivals?
options: Do not refrain from rejoicing with, and giving gifts to, the Levites on the Pilgrimage Festivals
Do not appear at the Temple without offerings
Take up a Lulav and Etrog all seven days
Rest on the Feast of Weeks
questions.correctAnswer: Do not refrain from rejoicing with, and giving gifts to, the Levites on the Pilgrimage Festivals
questions.explanation: Commandment #424 forbids neglecting the Levites during the Pilgrimage Festivals, as stated in Deuteronomy 12:19.
